headline: Lemon Chicken Orzo Soup
description: This lemon chicken orzo soup is packed with tender chunks of chicken in a lemony broth with orzo pasta, carrots, onions, celery, and baby spinach.
name: Lemon Chicken Orzo Soup
recipeIngredient: 3 medium carrots, chopped, or more to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste
3 (32 ounce) cartons fat-free, low-sodium chicken broth

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Stir in orzo and return to a boil. Cook pasta uncovered until partially cooked through but not yet soft, about 5 minutes; drain and rinse with cold water until cooled completely.

Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add carrots, celery, and onion; cook and stir until vegetables begin to soften and onion becomes translucent, 5 to 7 minutes. Add garlic; cook and stir until fragrant, about 1 minute more. Season mixture with thyme, oregano, bay leaf, salt, and black pepper; continue cooking another 30 seconds before pouring chicken broth into the pot.
Bring broth to a boil. Partially cover the pot, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer until vegetables are just tender, about 10 minutes.

Stir orzo, lemon juice, and lemon zest into broth; add chicken. Cook until chicken and orzo are heated through, about 5 minutes. Add baby spinach; cook until spinach wilts into broth and orzo is tender, 2 to 3 minutes. Ladle soup into bowls; garnish with lemon slices and Parmesan cheese.

review.reviewBody: This is delicious. My 7 year old thought so too. Added chard and okra, didn’t have spinach. Tasty. Will add to rotation of chicken soups.

I would love to say I followed the recipe exactly, but I was missing a few ingredients, so I improvised. I didn't have broth so I used chicken bouillon and a couple of veggie bouillon since I was out of celery and only had 1/2 an onion. I also cooked the chicken and orzo in the broth, and I only added maybe a tablespoon of lemon juice to it because my hubby isn't a fan of lemon, and I figured I can always add more to my bowl. Hubby tasted the soup, and he likes it! Will make this again, hopefully with the proper ingredients.

Delicious! My 9yo grandson's favorite soup. He calls it "Green Soup" because of the spinach. He has taken it to school for lunch so many times his teacher asked for the recipe. He said, "For a 4th grader to get that excited over a thermos of soup, it must be good".
Absolutely amazing! I just added 1 teaspoon of the rosemary and oregano instead of 1/2 teaspoon as we love herbs. We have tried a couple other recipes and this will be our go to for sure : )

So so good. My only change would yo not "pre make" the orzo. Because the orzo cooks so fast you can add it to the recipe uncooked when you add the chicken. It will cook in less than 10 min w everything else.

I absolutely love this soup, and think it's a great variation of regular chicken noodle or rice soup. I used the white meat from a rotisserie chicken, and added extra lemon juice (which gave it a brighter flavor). I'll definitely be adding this to my favorite soup recipes!
Yum !! made this for bible study, everyone loved it and asked me to make it again !!
Fantastic!! I did not change anything
I would put a little less lemon

I’d like to start this review by saying that soup of all kinds are my favorite food. I’d like to believe that I’ma soup connoisseur. That being said, This soup wasn’t bad. But I added a can of diced tomatoes and some Italian sausage and the result was the best soup I’ve ever had. Also, double the amount of lemon juice that the recipe calls for.

Came out exactly as expected, light lemon flavor. Orzo is a nice change of pace. Will make again. I heavily salted and peppered the chicken with a bit of poultry seasoning and that was enough salt/ pepper for the soup.
I added more Lemon Juice and less Chicken. It was very good. I also left out the spinach.

I've made this soup over and over ...it is such a favorite. The only thing I changed was I use 1/3 cup of lemon juice rather than half cup. Also I cook the orzo longer than 7 minutes because I like it a little softer. If I don't have chicken on hand I just use a can of the chicken. I also have noticed sometimes you'll have to add more broth since the orzo soaks it up.

I made a few tweaks to this recipe. First I used leftover chicken gravy from a previous recipe as the base and added broccoli spears. Aside from that, this recipe kicked it. I’d submit photos but the soup did not last long enough. My 12yo son who is a picky eater to begin with hammered it down like it was his last meal. This recipe also freezes very well.
Amazing recipe and we all loved it. I doubled the recipe for extras. Changes I made were to use fennel instead of onion and some green onion. Added a touch of dill as well. Great flavor.
It is delicious!

Great recipe! DOUBLED the veggies as well as the orzo, and used a skinned rotisserie chicken including the juices. Will make again with much LESS LEMON, and try uncooked orzo as one reviewer suggested (fewer pots the better). Served with grated parm and diced avocado. Husband isn't usually a big fan of soup, but really enjoyed this. Great way to get daily veggie servings, too!
My family liked it, but next time I will add more chicken and orzo.
Great recipe! Just perfect for a cold winter day.
Fast easy excellent!
Completely delish as written.
My husband and I loved it. Will use kale in place of spinach next time.
Loved this soup. Easy and full of flavor!
Great soup. I've made it twice. Once with the spinach and once without. Both were delicious. I will definitely make this again and again!
Remarkably flavorful and easy to prepare. I knew I’d have leftover soup, so I listened to other reviews and did not combine the orzo to the soup. I spooned some in the bowl and covered with the soup.

Maybe a solid 2.5 stars? I guess I'm in the minority as most people raved about this soup. It seemed pretty one-dimensional and lacked depth of flavor. I really wanted to love it, but just didn't. Wished I had saved my chicken breast and just made something else. Not sure what I missed.

Absolutely delicious! Flavor is on point! 
I cut the recipe in half. I made my own chicken broth using “Better than Boullion, and instead of fresh garlic, I used Better than Boullion Roasted Garlic. Since I was too lazy to cook chicken, I added small matzo balls that I had made yesterday! Absolute Perfection!
Nice recipe! Love that lemony flavor! I cheated and used rotisserie chicken and added a touch of dill. It's a winner!
Delicious! Wouldn't change a thing!
It is perfect as written. I added more lemon and finished with a dash of lemon pepper to my taste.
Excellent flavor, lemon was just subtle enough.

Great! Especially when I’m feeling under the weather. The lemon is perky and all the other ingredients build upon each other to a absolutely delicious meal. I try to use organic ingredients and at times have omitted some. Have never been disappointed in the results.
Love it! I added cilantro for that extra flavor. My man devoured it.

Like other reviewers, I keep the orzo separate as it soaks up the broth if you will have left overs. I also add spinach one serving at a time because it can get a little slimy if the soup sits in the frig for a few days. Otherwise, I make this exactly as written and it's amazing!
This is the perfect soup! I've made it twice and only change was cut back on the orzo so it was still soupy. Excellent recipe and thanks for sharing.
This is excellent. I didn't make any changes to the recipe and wouldn't make them in the future. It's perfect the way it is. We loved it!

I really like the flavors that this recipes brings to the table. I didn't have exactly everything on hand so I used what I did have. I cooked a chicken thigh & leg in the broth then shredded the meat off bone to add to the broth. The soup need more meat so I made small turkey meatballs and added them (raw) to the soup. I didn't have orzo in the pantry so I used 1/4 cup Ditalini #63 . That was plenty. Add more it you like a lot of pasta in your soup. Just remember that the pasta will absorb a lot of broth. You could cook the pasta on the side and add to the broth just before warming up a bowl. I also added the juice of one lemon a little at a time tasting until I like the flavor. Delicious!
This soup is so good! I did not have celery so I used celery salt. I also did not have spinach. Other than that I followed the recipe. Definitely one of our favorites meals!

Bright and yummy to warm you up on a cold winter’s day! I cooked the orzo in the soup so it was one pot cooking. For leftovers just add more broth or water. Or eat it more like pasta. It’s good any way you eat it! Floated some croutons on top with the parm. Yum!
We really liked this soup, just a tad too much lemon for our tastes though. Next time, I will reduce the amount of lemon juice

Straight-forward recipe - we followed it as written. Makes a very nice soup - the lemon adds a brightness to the dish, which might otherwise come across as a chicken noodle soup flavor - we'll make it again. Had some left over for the next day - the orzo soaked up nearly all the broth overnight so it was bursting with liquid - a very pleasant surprise. I may even consider making it a day before and letting the entire batch
This recipe is delicious! I did not deviate at all from the original recipe. Will definitely be making it again!
Fantastic! It makes a huge portion so I will freeze some! I added extra celery, carrots and spinach.
Meh...not great!
Amazing soup !!!!
I loved it. I used lemon pepper seasoning which gave great flavor

Absolutely delicious made exactly as-is!

If you've got a reason to make it, it'll obviously be better with homemade chicken stock. I'd made a roasted chicken a few days prior, so I made a stock from the carcass and used the leftover breast meat for the soup. I added a little more than 3 quarts of broth just because that's what I had made, but what the recipe calls for would have been plenty.
Followed recipe pretty close. Used more carrots and less lemon juice but it was tasty. Worth adding to my Soup Recipes Box.
This is a refreshing & delicious soup! My husband and I loved it!
Best soup I’ve made in a while that is broth based . The lemon made it!!! If your craving a warm you up in the fall and winter this is it !

This is one of my favorite soups from Panera. Since I moved and there isn't one near me, I can now make whenever I want. 

It is a really great receipe
Easy and delicious
Fantastic recipe have made twice now. I do also add ginger and a bit more garlic for an immune boosting kick.
I have made this several times. It is excellent. Even my neighbor asks me to make it now.
I made this a vegan soup. Just cut out the chicken and parmesan and use veggie broth instead. Delicious!
Easy to make and the family loved it. Highly recommend.

Because I forgot to buy the orzo when shopping for the ingredients, I substituted acini de pepo that I already had. That is the only change I made and the soup was delicious! I will definitely make it again.
This was very good. I followed recipe exactly.
This soup is wonderful! I make it often.
This is fabulous! It is delicious, filling and refreshing. We have given this as gifts to family and friends and they too day the same.
Perfect!
I tied this recipe of this delicious soup tonight. It was hit! I added shiitake mushrooms because why not. I loved how easy and quick this was to make. Thank you
Soup was really, good. Very flavorful and the amount of lemon flavor was just right. Will definitely add it to my "go to" soup recipes.
I used jasmine rice instead of orzo. Very tasty
Absolutely wonderful. I followed the suggestion of keeping the pasta separate but other than that I stayed true to the recipe. I definitely will be making this again.
We follow directions and used fresh Meyer lemons. It came out wonderfully, and delicious. We roasted that chicken in the morning, and shredded it for the soup.

Savory and delicious! During quarantine I looked for recipes that included ingredients I already had. This one was close, but I made a few swaps:
Orzo=brown rice
Chicken=turkey legs
Chicken broth=vegetable broth

I simmered turkey legs for about 6 hours in vegetable broth with celery tips and white onion. Let cool and refrigerated over night. Made for a very flavorful stock. 

Next day took meat off of bone, then put bones back in with all the veggies and seasonings. Added meat and cooked brown rice towards the end. 

When eating, I added a squeeze of lemon and a squirt of Sriracha for some spice. Reminded me of lemon grass soup from a local Vietnamese restaurant. 

My dad and husband loved it!

Perfect rainy day food-will make again for sure. Thinking of halibut in the soup next time?
Kids didn’t care for it but me and my husband loved it.

This recipe is perfect. However I did substitute brown rice for orzo only because that’s what I had. The combination of spices and the touch of lemon made the flavor of the broth taste so good. I added kale along with the baby spinach. Sooo good!!!

So good !! Best new way to use abundant lemons and rotisserie chicken breasts. Family loved it. Will add to routine. Made just as instructed. Only modification was one egg added at end.... totally yummm.
Delicious! I followed the recipe pretty closely but used a rosemary herb rotisserie chicken and added extra orzo.
I made this substituting rice for the orzo. Definite hit! I added more chicken and left out the spinach.
Instead of oregano and thyme I used fresh dill. This was delicious! The lemon flavor was light and not overwhelming. My whole family enjoyed it.
Absolutely delicious
Savory, bright, delicious. A great way to use leftover roasted chicken. I cut the recipe in half, using only half of the suggested amount of lemon juice. It turned out perfectly.

This was a great soup. I doubled the lemon zest and lemon juice. I like to sauté the chicken breasts in with the onions and vegetables. I then remove the chicken, chop it up and add it back at the end of the soup. I also used chard instead of spinach since that was available from my garden. My kids devoured this soup. I will be making it again. Maybe next time a little less orzo.
great!!

This Soup was delicious!
I just tweaked the original recipe a tad after reading a few reviews. I used Chunks of Rotisserie chicken and cooked the Orzo separately.
Super easy and quick. Delicious spin on chicken soup.

The soup was very good but too lemony and I love lemon, I would reduce the amount of fresh lemon juice, I squeezed lemons from our tree so it was very fresh, I did add extra vegi's to make more of a stew but will add more broth next time, 4 cups wasn't enough.
Love this soup. Sometimes I leave the chicken out but it tastes great either way. I make it regularly- leaving the orzo on the side to eat for lunch a few days in a row.
This soup is excellent and actually freezes well. I make it for the two of us and then freeze it in meal-size containers. I think we could eat it every day!
Delicious-Great flavors
I would add less chicken stock but overall good recipe

Very good. It seems to make a lot of broth for the amount of soup, so I cut down the broth and adjusted the lemon/salt accordingly to taste. I also kept the Orzo separate so that it wouldn't soak up all the broth (leftovers). It was a lovely soup, I'll make it again for sure.
I use a little less lemon juice.

It was a really good base recipe to follow for those looking for some loose guidelines. What I liked most about this recipe is it's spice profiles. I LOVE thyme and bay, and they really gave the soup a nice, fragrant taste and smell. Personally, I found that this amount of lemon was overpowering, so I corrected by adding a bit more water and some chicken bouillon (I didn't buy any extra chicken broth). In addition, I really bulked up the veggies in this dish to make it a hearty, fulfilling soup.

I didn't care for this. It was a bit bland for my taste. I had to at least double the seasonings and added a lot of garlic powder. The lemon was a nice touch though a bit more than suits my taste. This may fade a bit as the soup sits overnight and is reheated. Also, I thought it could use a little more vegetable to make it more substantial. That however is an easy fix.
I have made this a couple of times and it light, clean and delicious. The last time I made it with half the lemon juice and increased the chicken and cut size of vegetables. My boys like it hearty.
Made it for me and my mom and we loved. Will definitely be making again soon especially since its cooling off temperature wise.

Great flavor and texture. Made this as directed except I used precooked lemon chicken. Regarding the “adding orzo before serving will make it a casserole” - that’s how I made it, with extra orzo, and the next day it was still a soup.
Fantastic!
Delicious! Followed the recipe to a tee and it turned out great!

I picked the hottest day of the summer so far to make soup. 100 on a Sunday afternoon in mid July. But we've all been sick and I thought this might make us feel a little better. It taste amazing!! The lemon and the parm cheese put it over the top.
the best soup ever!
I needed a bit more milk as my batter was dry but I have made this recipe at least 50 times it's a favorite here!
I made this for an afternoon tea. It was delicious!

I love this soup. The one change I made, I used my own chicken stock because it had more flavor. It didn't let the lemon juice overpower it. More of a balance in flavor. Also, I didn't have any fresh parmesan on hand. We didn't miss it.
I used 1/4 c. of lemon juice instead of 1/2 c.. It was delicious!
